medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain, steady and constant, in the right upper quadrant (RUQ).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began acutely following a same day colonoscopy. The patient experienced persistent RUQ pain, rigors, fever, and chills after initially being sent home. Repeat CT showed increased gallbladder (GB) wall thickening and air in the GB wall.
